title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments:
Everything Everywhere All at Once. 

Michelle Yeoh, multiverses, googly eyes, and butt plugs to transport you to a different reality.

Saw Top Gun maverick in theatres, what an experience!! The way they have shot the flight sequence is mesmerising. EVen though the plot is predictable, it never fails to entertain.

10/10 would recommend.

A [Malayalam Movie Poster](https://i.imgur.com/koAsHWt.jpg).  

I haven't seen the movie and apparently it's about a serious topic but the Name (from a North Indian Hindi context) and the face coverings just gives off a different vibe.
Watching Bosch on prime It's amazing. Also liked king Richard.
Watched Jojo Rabbit a day before yesterday. Absolutely amazing stuff.
Agree, its even more amazing when you know all shots had been done without any CGI. I read somewhere the rent for F18 per hour is around USD 10K
How did ya see it? It isn't on any OTT yet and it isn't running anywhere in India. Man I wanna see it so bad.
Does one need to see the first part?
Yes but you can just watch a recap on YouTube and remember some of the characters
